meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Get ready to rumble with Travis Strikes Again: No More Heroes, a wild ride that's as quirky as it is unpredictable. This hack-and-slash adventure defies expectations and will have you laughing out loud one minute, face-palming the next (don't worry, I'm doing the same thing).

GamingTrend praises this zany game for its "uncompromisingly zany" design, fluid combat, and laugh-out-loud personality. And honestly, who can argue with that? It's like they're speaking directly to my hip-hop loving, gaming-obsessed soul.

But don't just take their word for it! The Games Machine calls it a "colorful, crazy, and unpredictable" appetizer (nice one) while XGN describes it as a "psychedelic adventure" with a mix of game genres. I mean, what's not to love about that?

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "Hold up, isn't this game just a low-budget mess?" And, okay, fair point. The Sydney Morning Herald does point out its smaller scale and repetitive fighting can make it feel dull at times. But hey, who doesn't love a good dose of weirdness in their gaming experience? It's like the reviewer said, "Playing Travis Strikes Again is an experience I'm glad I had..."

On the other hand, 3DJuegos seems to be saying, "Hey, if you're into Suda51's style, give it a shot!" Which, honestly, is all about that weirdness and cultural references (I mean, who doesn't love a good dose of pop culture in their gaming?).

But, oh boy, Switch Player is having none of it. They call it a "messy concoction" with a confusing story, irrelevant co-op, and muddy visuals. Ouch! Looks like Travis might've struck out with this one...

And finally, Gameblog.fr sums it up best: "The disappointment is up to the punk, idiotic and meta fun that the first two No More Heroes provided." Yeah, I feel that. Like, where's the hype train? Where's the love?

So there you have it, folks! Travis Strikes Again: No More Heroes - a game that'll make you laugh, cry (from frustration), and maybe even question what on earth Suda51 was thinking. It's like they say: "When life gives you lemons, make lemonade." In this case, when life gives you weirdness, just roll with it!
